Ok so the reason why you don't see warmup limits not updating in the dashboard after you make changes is that our system takes time to actually apply these changes. Usually it updates within couple hours or 1 day tops. ​

There are safety mechanisms to prevent warmup from immediate changes as some users could amend their limits and other settings many times within very short time, and instantly applying these changes to live warmup process could trigger ESPs and spam filters

Hello Team, I am a security researcher who discovered some potential vulnerabilities on your site. One of these is a clickjacking issue, which I wanted to bring to your attention. Issue: Clickjacking Clickjacking, also known as a UI redress attack, can trick users into performing actions they did not intend to by overlaying multiple transparent layers on a webpage. This technique can also be used to capture keystrokes. Proof of Concept: <html> <body> <iframe height="500" width="500" src=" https://app.pipl.ai/v2/register/ " ></iframe> </body> </html> Impacts: This vulnerability can be exploited to hijack user interactions, leading to unauthorized actions on your website. Recommended Fix: To mitigate this issue, it is recommended to implement the X-Frame-Options HTTP response header or the Content-Security-Policy frame-ancestors directive. References: X-Frame-Options Documentation OWASP Clickjacking Guide Note: I’m hoping to receive a bounty reward for my current finding. I will be looking forward to hearing from you on this and will be reporting other vulnerabilities accordingly. Kind Regards, Andrew Snapshot:

SiteGround's Startup plan, as a shared hosting plan, utilizes a shared IP address. This means your website will share the same IP address as other websites hosted on the same server.

SiteGround's GoGeek shared hosting plan includes a free dedicated IP address. This means your website will have its own unique IP, rather than sharing one with other websites on the same server. While the GoGeek plan is a shared hosting plan, it provides the benefit of a dedicated IP.

SiteGround's GrowBig plan typically uses a shared IP address. While it's designed for hosting multiple websites and can handle a large volume of traffic, it doesn't come with a dedicated IP address as standard. You can opt for a dedicated IP address as an add-on service if needed.

Hi Taylor, warmup stats are accurate for our warmup pool but you need to understand it's a safe and controlled environment where accounts grow their reputation. It could not be used to fully access inbox placement rate in for real life campaigns. You can try to run email placement tests in specialized tools like GlockApps to better understand where your emails are landing. also, we have learning algo to send at the best time

When you launch 2 campaigns with same set of inboxes something like this happens: 1) you enable 1st campaign a bit earlier then 2nd one 2) inbox sends first batch of emails from each inbox and minimal time delay is started 3) after minimal time is passed, your inboxes will start sending emails with your 1st campaign still because it was enabled earlier, and hence emails are higher in the sending queue on the back end compared to emails in campaign 2 Your inboxes however, can still send 1 email per hour only

yes if you set the campaign limit to 1k, the logic will pace the sends accordingly, that's already the current logic
yes so there's no way to spread those emails out in the early stages of ramping up a campaign
because we're relyign on inbox limits
campaign limit is unaware of inbox limits
correct,  campaign limit is unaware of inbox limit.   I'm still not sure if I follow your issue

scenario: i'm launching a new campaign with new inboxes -- campaign ramp-up on for those inboxes, starting at 1/day for each inbox. let's say i have 10 inboxes. let's say the campaign sending window is 10 hours. my target campaign limit is high, 1k. if i set it as 1k, the campaign is thinking: "i have to send 1k emails today so i will send 100 per hour." in the first hour, the campaign will totally exhaust the sending capacity within 1 hour.
meaning those inboxes do not get to send gently throughout the day. they send all at once and if 2 people flag it as spam it's a terrible way to start its outbound reputation
so now i manually set the campaign limit to be 50. but i will have to update that every week
in almost any scenario, outbound senders are going to want to spread out the sends. so i think the algo should try to optimize for that, however the backend is set up
it's not possible for the campaign to be aware of inbox limit and control the pace, because one account can be connected to multiple campaigns..etc.     but I get your point, let us think about it

Looking at most of my accounts are achieving close to 100% deliverability for all ESP within Pipl warmup pool. I periodically test this manually using Mailreach, it was showing some accounts score was 6/10 etc (usually Microsoft that they didn't inbox), which one is more accurate stats I should be paying attention to?
@yaro.  can you also add this warmup signal thing into macro so we can reuse enxt time

I won't 100% rely on Mailreach. if you test it with other email placement platform you will get quite different result. But 100% deliverability also doesn't mean you will get 100% deliverability in any actual campaign, in fact, it won't even come close to that. One of the reason is because warmup is composed of a pool of accounts and once inboxes in the warmup pool have communicated once, all further warmups between them may never land in spam because the positive signals have already happened. Another reason is that in warmup, we're sending different content to different email address each time.  But for your actual campaign, you're sending similar content to a lot of leads. Warmup is a good indicative measure of whether the accounts are ready. if you see a warmup health score > 95%, those accounts should be ready to start sending. ​

Thanks for this. I agree that every placement platform shows different results. hey guys was just wondering about your inbox service. how different is it from stuff like premium inboxes? is it the same deliverability if i were to register google workspaces on my own?

Hi Mark, it's quite similar and it's not always clear what the difference is - to put it simply, core difference is infrastructure isolation. When you use our inbox service, each client gets their own Google Workspace admin panel — meaning your entire sending setup is isolated. No one else’s behavior can impact your deliverability. Some other inbox providers stack hundreds of clients under a single admin — which might work short-term, but it’s risky long-term and totally outside your control. With us, you own the domain, the inbox, and the setup — and we configure everything (SPF, DKIM, DMARC, warm-up, DNS, etc.) for optimal cold email performance. Hope that clears it up :-)

Hello, When I launch new campaign suddenly it starts with 99.3% open rate which is not possible in any way
Don’t track open rate. It’s a vanity metric these days
Why does my open rate not look accurate? plusvibe.ai (ex pipl.ai) Support Team
But I want to track Open rate anyay
open rate is very important for me
The real question is why your system is tracking it wrong

just to clarify — it’s not our system tracking it wrong. Tracking opens via pixel fires is inherently flawed and unreliable these days. More importantly, it hurts your deliverability. Badly. Most modern inbox providers treat open tracking like a red flag. We’ve made a conscious decision to not lean on that metric for exactly that reason — it’s not worth killing your placement just to chase a number that doesn’t mean much anymore. If open rates are still a priority for you, fair enough — but there are other tools out there that focus on that. We’re focused on what gets real replies. Hope that helps.

I get it. When you cant see open rates, you cant measure the pre-success. Or you can say success of subject line that case user to open or ignore email. What are available current stats we can use to define good or bad email other than replies

reply rate is the only universal metric that matters in cold email. It’s the one stat that proves your message actually resonated with a real human — not just got skimmed, clicked, or auto-opened by a bot.

My email copy is extremely personalized.
Hi, no it's unlikely the volume issue. Your copy oftentime includes spam or risky words which ESPs could easily flag ​
Hmm.. but as far as I know "click-through rates" is in a different context than "Here is  our rates" or something similar, no?
contextually, yes - but it does not mean you won't be flagged. It's safer option just to avoid words like these altogether
and shouldn't the warmup emails reflect the actual deliverability score?  Because warmups look okay.

Warmup score could be used as initial check but it can not fully reflect possible deliverability issues. Warmup process is like a sandbox - a very comfortable and easy environment to grow and maintain reputation over time

I would still suggest to run an email placement test with specialized tool

warmup saved from spam is accurate.

Warmup score is a good indication of your email account health. Anything above 90% generally means there is no major issue with your infrastructure setup, and neither your domain nor IP is blacklisted. However, this does not guarantee the same deliverability for your actual campaign emails. ​ This is mainly because the warmup pool involves exchanging emails between users, and once a few positive signals are triggered, such as moving warmup emails from spam to inbox, the ESP may stop flagging the same sender account. In addition, warmup emails are usually unique, whereas campaign emails often send out the same content in bulk, which can easily trigger spam filters.

we understand the confusion. If it doesn't meet your expectation, would you want a full refund?

Hey Sid, ​ Thanks for reaching out — great questions. ​ To clarify: Pipl.ai isn’t a Mailchimp-style newsletter tool — we’re built specifically for cold outreach and sales automation. That means we're optimized for 1:1-style messages that look and feel personal (vs. bulk marketing-style emails). ​ That said, if you want to send messages to new website subscribers as part of a personalized outbound flow , you can totally do that using Pipl.ai. Just keep in mind: Emails will be sent from your own connected inbox , so yes — your subscribers will receive the message from your email address. If it’s a new domain or inbox, we recommend warming it up first . Pipl.ai has built-in warmup you can use to make sure you don’t land in spam. If you're planning to send transactional or marketing-style emails (like Mailchimp does), you might be better off using a traditional ESP like Mailchimp, ConvertKit, etc.

Makes sense. How do I set a time in between each send on an inbox level (not just on a domain level)? Even if what you say is true, I think that's safer. Otherwise hundreds of emails get sent out within just a few minutes (from the azure inboxes).
Hi David, you can configure minimum wait time for inboxes here: ​
sorry that's not what i meant
It needs to be on a campaign level
Say I have 200 azure inboxes in one campaign
50 inboxes each, 4 domains
I don't want dozens of emails to go out all at once
I need it to spaced out, every few minutes
Is that possible?

Campaign will space out emails to match sending volume with the schedule. It's does not matter from deliverability perspective if it's dozen emails or a hundred emails within couple minutes because outgoing emails are spaced out for each inbox and domain. If we set spacing out of couple minutes on campaign level it would effectively make large volume sending impossible

So campaign sends what it needs to send following the schedule it needs to make sure all planned volume goes out. As long as you have many inboxes with the campaign, and respective delay settings set properly, campaign will not skipe sending for any of your inboxes. There's no risk of triggering any volume-based triggers from ESPs or spam filters

How does my account language make their email land in spam? Confusing
it doesn't. landing in spam is normal, it's part of the warmup process. But we failed to rescue them from your Spam is because your Spam folder is in foreign language.
I see. My warmup says 0.2% have landed in spam. On average this would be around 100 000 mails sent to this one inbox, meaning 0.2% of those on average land in spam. Sound correct?

yes. Warmup score is a good indication of your email account health. Anything above 90% generally means there is no major issue with your infrastructure setup, and neither your domain nor IP is blacklisted. However, this does not guarantee the same deliverability for your actual campaign emails. This is mainly because the warmup pool involves exchanging emails between users, and once a few positive signals are triggered, such as moving warmup emails from spam to inbox, the ESP may stop flagging the same sender account. In addition, warmup emails are usually unique, whereas campaign emails often send out the same content in bulk, which can easily trigger spam filters.

This would mean that the warm up pool has sent other users' emails 100 000x times on my email to get that couple of hundred to land in spam. Or even if the percentage for them was not 0.2, but 2%, it would still be 10 000 warmup emails sent to this particular address. Does that sound right?
wait, what you see in spam is spam from OTHERS, not emails you have sent

some users could have 30% spam rate
so a lot of these users email would land in your spam
Ahaa. Why do they land in spam so often?
usually their domains are burnt, or poor infrastructure setup
as I said, usually, for healthy accounts, 90%+ is expected
for blacklisted domain / IP, they would have spam rate up to 60-70%
i.e. 70% landing in spam
What are they still doing in the warmup pool? Trying to recover?
for 70%+, there is still a chance to recover if they pause campaign sending but our algo has auto matching to send to healthy domains only

please set unlimited inbox connect limit

Hi Nazmul, there's a fair usage policy in place for all accounts. Unfortunately we wont be able to connect more than 1k inboxes to Business account type as it would put tremendous load on our servers.
But it was motioned unlimited into plan—meaning there should be no limit on the number of inboxes connected. What's happening for all LTD users?

I understand the confusion, but this fair usage policy is something that we implemented long time ago to ensure stability of our system. A lot of tools in the market communicate they have unlimited inboxes, but the same fair usage policy applies with every other tool. ​

I’ve never faced this issue with Instantly.ai or Saleshandy—we were able to connect unlimited inboxes there. I need a higher limit based on my requirements. Please consider increasing the limit for me as this is an important request.
It will be $100 per month per additional 1000 connected accounts

Just to clarify, we’ve invested a ton of time and resources into building one of the most stable, secure, and deliverability-friendly warm-up systems on the market. The reason we apply limits is to protect that infrastructure and ensure long-term deliverability performance for every user on the platform, especially as we scale. Most platforms that advertise "unlimited" still have similar usage policies under the hood — they’re just not always visible upfront.

Yes, I got it. But only a few tools have inbox limits—like Smartlead, which promotes unlimited inboxes in their plan but actually has restrictions. I understand your point. However, most scalable platforms used by many users offer truly unlimited inbox connections. As I mentioned, tools like Instantly.ai and Saleshandy allow unlimited inboxes, and many of my clients are using them based on their needs. Now that I'm aware of the limitations here, I’ll make sure to mention them when referring your tool to clients. Otherwise, they might not proceed or be satisfied—especially since many clients run small campaigns but connect multiple inboxes for different sending needs. Hopefully, you'll consider increasing the limit in the future, as other tools are already doing.

Totally understand if this is a dealbreaker for you. ​ Our infrastructure isn’t built for unlimited, unmanaged volume — it’s built for long-term deliverability, stability, and protecting every customer’s inbox reputation. ​ If the priority is connecting thousands of inboxes with no oversight, there are definitely other platforms that may better fit that use case. We’re not trying to compete in that lane — and we’re totally fine with that. ​ We’ll happily process a refund if you'd prefer to move on. No hard feelings at all — we just focus on doing this the right way. ​ Let me know what you’d like to do.

Hi Megan! To add sender accounts to your campaign, please follow the steps below: Click on Campaigns from the left pane menu.​ Select the campaign to which you want to add email profiles by clicking on it.​ Click on the three dots and select the Edit option from the drop-down menu.​ Click on the Settings ⚙️ option in the campaign's edit screen.​ In the Sending Email Accounts section, click on the Select Sending Email Accounts drop-down.​ Select one or more emails from the list. If you select multiple emails, they will be used in rotation for sending emails.​ ​ Then lastly click on the Save button at the bottom left corner to save changes. ​

Pipl.ai doesn't currently have a built-in option to send test events for webhooks. But you can still test your webhook setup by triggering real events inside Pipl.ai based on the ones you've configured. Hi, the term "All Email Replies" refers to any responses received from the prospects in your sequence. This event is triggered when a prospect replies to an email sent from your campaign. It's important to note that this does not pertain to outgoing replies sent by your team.

I would like to add an email address to receive alerts when a positive reply occurs

Hi! Yes, you can receive immediate email notifications for positive replies. To enable this feature, please follow these steps: Log in to your Pipl.ai account. Go to Workspace Settings . Click on AI Reply Labels . Scroll down to "Send Email Notification for Positive Replies" . Enter the email address(es) where you'd like to receive notifications. To add multiple emails, simply separate them with commas. Hope this helps!

Hi team, can you clarify which api endpoint should I use if I am trying to get the first name of a specific sender email account I've added to Pipl?
Hi Alex, thanks for reaching out! We're currently looking into this and will get back to you shortly.

Hi Alex, You can use the https://api.pipl.ai/api/v1/account/list endpoint to get details for your email accounts. If you only need the first name, feel free to include just the first_name in the payload when setting up the sender. ​
i just need to get the first name for 1 specific email account though
not all
the one you gave lists all emails rite?

You're right — the /api/v1/account/list endpoint does return all email accounts in your workspace. Right now, there isn't a dedicated endpoint to fetch just one specific email account by email address. The best approach is to: Use /api/v1/account/list Filter the results on your end to find the specific email (e.g., example@email.com ) Then extract the first_name from payload.name.first_name I totally understand it's not the most direct method, but this is currently the available way to retrieve that info.

there is pagination.  he will need to use page_trail to get more results
However, if you need to pull more than 100 results, you can use the page_trail value from the response to get the next batch.
how to use that
page trial
trail
can you clarify the steps please

Hey Alex! Sure! So page_trail is used when the results don’t all fit in one response — kind of like a “next page” button. After you make your first API call, the response might include a page_trail value. That means there’s more data available. To get the next set of results: Copy the page_trail from the response. Make the same API call again, but add ?page_trail=that_value at the end of the URL. You can keep using the new page_trail from each response to go to the next page, until there’s no more. Macro suggestion for checking.

I had another question
when you calculate reply rate %, do you include bounced leads in total leads to calculate that or do you exclude them
We don’t count bounced leads when calculating the reply rate. It’s based on the number of replies divided by the number of emails that were actually delivered.

Bounced leads aren’t included when calculating the reply rate—it’s based only on emails that were successfully delivered. Also, auto-replies like out-of-office messages or system-generated responses aren’t counted in the reply rate stats either.

Hello, I am a new trial user. I haven't used the software yet. But, the features are awesome. I am very interested.
Hi :) Thank you!

I've used a wide range of cold outreach and email marketing platforms, and I genuinely appreciate your pricing structure. However, the monthly email limit seems quite restrictive. For instance, with 100,000 contacts, a 150,000-email cap is quickly exceeded once follow-up sequences are included. A limit closer to five to ten times the contact count would better accommodate standard multi-touch campaigns.
How can I increase the monthly email limit?

I understand that the current limits may not meet your needs, and I want to assure you that we will look into this for you. I'll discuss your specific requirements with our billing team to explore potential solutions, including custom plans or adjustments to our current offerings.
How many emails are you looking to send monthly? We might need to look for a custom plan for you
I am thinking in terms of contacts. the first month will probably be 10,000 new contacts and the second month would be 50,000 and then 50,000 added per month with a 3 email sequence.
To be candid, I am comparing you to smartlead.ai and instantly.ai.
As you can see, with you currently pricing structure and limits, that really isn't possible.
I'm not sure if companies you mentioned have different pricing model. We in fact give more features and options for the same money or less. ​
I agree in general. I am a SaaS founder/owner as well. I also own a marketing agency. I have used at least 15 cold email platforms.
Like I mentioned earlier, you do have great features. The two stand out features to me are; 1. being able to purchase pre-warmed gmail accounts 2. LinkedIn scraping/personalization
But, I think that you are missing the mark wrt the total email volume. In cold email, volume is the game.

I would even suggest to you that I think that you can capture a lot of the market by beating those comps email volume and then do a marketing campaign consisting of comparison UGC YT vids and blog post.
You have what they are missing
But, i can't scale and I cannot use your software as an agency.

Thanks for your feedback. The limits we have for our base plans are configured in a way to handle most users needs and also be financially viable for the company. If you need to use a software with higher limits - we can surely chat about the custom plan many of our agency clients are using. But it's unlikely you would be able to run a whole agency operation with just the base plan.

We can surely increase the volume on base plans to be x3 or x5 - but that will also force us to raise our prices, which we won't do at the moment in order to effectively run business in current competitive environment.
Got. I was assuming that the email cost would be low. But, if it eats too much into profit margin, I get it.
Okay, well, thanks for considering. I am going to give it a shot. Bye.

Hey guys - is there record of all the emails sent from a campaign I can find? Reason being, it had a high bounce rate but I checked the bounced ones in a few verification tools and they're fine. Hi Luke, it's not quite starighfoward to get a record of ALL emails sent with campaign, but you can check on specific emails sent to your bounced leads by clicking on their card in you prospect list ​
You will also see a specific reason of bounce if you mouse over the bounce alert

oh cool thanks. Yeh most say it couldn't be delivered as the mailbox is disabled. Is that strange that I ran them through multiple verification tools and they come back valid but show up as disabled mailbox when sending?

any validation tool is not perfect. The tech is doing SMTP pings mainly, but there could be cases when the email account gets disabled after verification or there could be some misconfiguration of the mail server.
A good example would be an email address of someone who left the company and their email was disabled from receiving emails while still retaining the email license for whatever internal reason
This email will show as valid on any validation tool but will bounce when you try to send actual email.
It's just a risk that we all accept in this industry. Generally healthy bounce rate for verified leads should be below 5%
yeh makes sense - I generally aim to keep below 3% but this campaign was 10% so might burn my inboxes if I just let it run
It could happen, just bad luck really... or a poor quality lead list with maybe some personal emails?

Yeh they're personal emails. I ran one to gmails and its great - 0.1% bounce rate. But the yahoos, aol, hotmails is this campaign with the high bounce rate. I think they must block some SMTP pings or something
Yes, could happen. Personal emails are much harder to land into both from standpoint of deliverability and verifying them properly
oh ok. Thank you

Hi, I am warming up both accounts with Pipl. The results show that none of the emails have gone to the spam box. However when I do a check online, they always go to the spam folder. Why is there a difference between Pipl and online tools? I am concerned that my emails will continue to go to non-Pipl warm up accounts when sending emails
Hi

The difference between warmup score vs actual campaigns are because of below: 1. When you warmup, you send against a pool or users. Once the positive signal has been triggered for a few times within the pool, ESP may no longer flag warmup email as spam 2. Warmup email content is different from actual campaign content 3. Even for placement test tool, their result could be very different depending on the receiving side
Warmup has proven to be useful to improve deliverability, but doesn't mean 100 percent landing in inbox
Use it as a gauge for your email health instead
This is same for all providers, we didn't fake our warmup stats or whatsoever

Hi Team, We have detected that your website is vulnerable to this vulnerability. Vulnerability Type: Victim Flooding/DOS/Server Crash Severity: Critical Description: I found victim mailbox flooding due to no rate limit on sending forget password emails. The issue is that there is a speed bump missing in the sending of forgetting password emails area. This would eventually let the attacker spam to *any *random email resulting in the exhaustion of resources on your side. I generated more than 100 forget password email requests and I received a number of forget password email requests within no time and I was able to flood the email. because there is no rate limitation on the forget password email requests area. Steps To Reproduce: Go To forget password page Capture the request and send the request to the Burp Intruder Put the payload on the email parameter Start Attack Proof of concept: The Response after more than 100 Requests. Impact: This poses a significant threat to the integrity and reputation of your organization. Attackers can flood anyone's email by sending the forget password request emails and also they will be able to flood your server with tons of forgetting password requests within no time which will lead to server crashes. And more attackers will be able to execute malicious scripts on the sending of forgetting password requests endpoint. As there's no rate limit placed for the user's security and for your application as well. -Victim Flooding -Dos Attack On Forget Password Requests Endpoint -Forget Password Requests Page Becomes Un Responsive -Server Crash Fix : Set a captcha on sending Forget password requests so attackers will not be able to exploit this vulnerability flaw. Sincerely, John Lee

Hi team We have detected that your website is vulnerable to this vulnerability Vulnerability Type: User Account Hacking / No Rate Limit On Login Vulnerable URL: https://app.pipl.ai/sign-in There is a reason which makes an attacker able to hack any user's account. There is No Lockout Mechanism ( rate limit ) Description : There is no mitigation, defenses in any way, or lockout mechanism on the login page. A malicious-minded user can continually try to brute force an account password. you can implement a captcha for its protection. I have tried to input 180 incorrect passwords to show you that there is no rate limit on the login page and I have not been locked out. As I observe on other websites they have a lock-out mechanism if a user tries to input 20 incorrect passwords. So you should also have a lock-out mechanism for user account security. Proof Of Concept : Response after more than 170 requests: Now the response of the correct password: Steps to reproduce : 1. Go to https://app.pipl.ai/sign-in 2. Enter any registered email with the wrong password. 3. Capture the request & Send the request to Intruder and add a Payload Marker on the password value. 4. Add the payload for the password field. 5. Start an attack. Impact : There are no lockout mechanisms Attackers can do a lot of tries Attackers Can brute force The Victim's login details as shown in the screenshots. So, due to this vulnerability, the Attacker can Brute force the log-in detail and then take over the account. Mitigation: There should be a captcha on login page to prevent this vulnerability. Please let me know if you need more information. Sincerely, John Lee

Hi. I set up a custom tracking domain for my email accounts, I turned on 2 campaigns today but they have the open rate disabled as per suggested by the platform to improve deliverability. According to one of your articles: "Email tracking refers to monitoring your recipients' behavior like if an email is opened or if any links in the email were clicked etc. To obtain this information for you, we add a code to the email’s body.". If I already set up my custom domain, do I need to enable the open email tracking? Will it still afect my deliverability? Where can I see if any links in the email where clicked?
Hi Laura, it's still recommended to not track open and we don't have link click tracking for that exact reason. Setting up custom domain won't affect your deliverability

That's not what this article implies: https://help.pipl.ai/en/articles/9447891-custom-tracking-domain . What is the purpose of setting up a custom tracking domain if i'm not going to be able to get any recipient behavior metrics?

The reality is custom tracking domains is only use to track open rate. Open rate tracking in turn decreases your chances to land in recipient inbox. It's a legacy technology, and you should not use it. Instead you should optimize your campaigns for reply rate and use it as a primary metric

I need a help here can you please explain to me what will be the bad effect and how do I set my account. I want all my email address to send atleast 150 email pr day

Hi! Thanks for reaching out. Regarding sending at least 150 emails per day from your account, this is generally not recommended due to several potential negative effects: It can trigger spam filters. Sending a high volume of emails from a single account looks like spam to email providers, damaging your sender's reputation. It can overload email servers. Most standard email accounts have daily sending limits, and exceeding these can lead to temporary or permanent restrictions. It's difficult to manage effectively. Tracking engagement, handling bounces, and managing a high volume of individual sends become very challenging in a standard inbox. It could be seen as a security risk. Email providers might flag such activity as suspicious, potentially leading to account suspension. It often results in poor deliverability. Without proper list management and targeting, you'll likely see low engagement and high bounce rates, further harming your ability to reach inboxes.
You might find this resource helpful: https://pipl.ai/blog/email-sending-limits-of-email-service-providers?utm_source=chatgpt.com#faqs-frequently-asked-questions

Hello, Could you please tell me more about your email verification methodology? Any technical info you can send would be very helpful. For example, do you actually send out emails to the full list to see if a bounce occurs? I'm also quite interested in how you handle "risky" emails (both 'catch-all' emails as well as 'unknowns'). I'm trying to decide on whether I'll need to use an external service for any part of the email validation or if Pipl's offering is sufficient. Thank you

Hey Nwamaka, ​ Great questions — happy to walk you through it. ​ So no, we don’t send emails to the whole list just to see what bounces (that would be a deliverability nightmare). Instead, our system checks a bunch of things quietly in the background — like whether the email format looks good, if the domain exists, and if the mail server is actually set up to receive emails. We also ping the server (without sending anything) to see if the address is legit. ​ For the trickier ones — like catch-alls or addresses that just won’t give a clear yes/no — we mark them as “risky” or “unknown” based on a confidence score depending on confirmations we can find elsewhere on the web, like if person mentioned their email in some publicly available profile. That way, you can decide if you want to keep them in or play it safe and leave them out. ​ Most folks using Pipl.ai don’t need a separate verification tool, but it really depends on how strict you want to be with your lists.
Do you not have a way to track link clicks?
Hi, we do not support tracking link clicks as this practice affects your chances to land in prospects inboxes
Do you recommend using something like linktr.ee then? or utm value?

No, links in general are not advised practice for cold emails. Link shorteners carry even more risk for ESPs and spam filters. Usually we advise users to optimize their campaigns to receiving replies from prospects, and you can send them a link after
Understood. Another question. How does the concept of ESP matching work? If the target email uses Microsoft, do I need to have an email account which uses Microsoft servers?
Yes, we will match same providers during sending but you need to have inboxes. Also advanced ESP matching will allow you to build custom rules of what senders engage with what recipients

I’m not sure I follow the question.. but yes many users have distributed sending domains with different email providers for this purpose. For now we just launched GSuite inboxes infrastructure, it’s currently in beta. You will see the form when clicking the button to connect your inboxes.

Hi - I wanted to ask about a deliverability issue we are having. We have been having a high bounce rate seemingly with Microsoft emails specifically within our campaigns but when I just the warm-up area for the emails we are seeing high 90s or even 100% deliverability with Microsoft so I am just curious what might cause that discrepancy
you can see that all the bounce are pretty much because of Spamhaus
all these recipient are non Google nor MS
in our warmup, if the warmup email is blocked by Spamhaus, we don't flag it as spam, because there are a lot of false positive
and you're sharing same main domain for all your email accounts
So, in my current campaigns that are paused I actually removed all of the Microsoft emails because initially it looked like it was almost entirely MS.
So would you recommend removing all of the non-google or MS?
no, your domain seems fine still.  could be the content
And I take it that means it is also negatively effecting us to be using sub-domains
for this, it looks to be related to your sending server
I hope cfo-simplied.com is not main business domain. It will negatively affect it even you're using subdomain
you're getting lot of these bounces. seems more related to your sender server than microsoft
It is not the main business domain - we made a similar domain and then made the subs off of that
you need to use more alternate domain
subdomain is the same in ESP's eyes
Got it okay - I will check into more domains and the issue with the sender
sure in short, three issues you have to look at 1. diversify your sending domain 2. issue with sending server 3. adjust your content to avoid getting flagged by spamhaus
Thank you very much

Hi Team, we have integration with hubspot Today we have an interested prospect that needs to be transferred to our pipeline but still not showing . Please advise

Hi Nasko, In order for leads status and activities to sync between Pipl and Hubspot, the leads either: 1) have to be added from Hubspot list 2) or they have to be uploaded from Pipl (when you upload the CSV, check "Sync leads to Hubspot if they didn't exist already in Hubspot)
thank you
can i sync them after the lists are imported to pipl?

no, that's not possible.  When you import to Pipl via uploading CSV, there is an option to sync to Hubspot as well, you have to do it at that stage, as we need to map the lead between Pipl and Hubspot  (associate them)

Zach Gordon (DataMiner) Mar 26, 2025, 09:45 PDT Hi Usama, Thanks for your understanding, and yes, scraping these sites is possible. Scraping sub-level data is a common scenario and Data Miner is designed to handle this. But rather than clicking back and forth, Data Miner actually uses URLs for its' automation. This process is called a Crawl. The process is outlined on the following help page: https://dataminer.io/help/crawl . This process requires two recipes. You need to scrape the detail page URLs off of the search results page using one recipe and then Data Miner visits the URL and then scrapes the detail page's data using the second recipe. You can make the recipes yourself by looking at our tutorials here: https://dataminer.io/help/recipe-creator or we can make them for you for $300 total ($150 each). The Crawl feature does also require a paid plan as well, but you can test it with a free plan. You can view paid plans here: https://dataminer.io/pricing Our paid plans are easy to cancel when you don't need them anymore and there is no commitment. the tricky thing about the 7/14 days is that stats are generally comprehensive meaning the current reply rate is the average across all the days up until this point. and so if you grab the current reply rate you are also "feeling" the reply rate from before that time period. so in an ideal world we would see the overall stat and the "last 7 days" stat as a separate figure (kind of like how i assume your date filter works). and the "last 7 days stat" contains the modifier, so there is overall reply rate: 5% last 7 days reply rate: 4% (-.6%) where the -.6% is comparing the last 7 days reply rate to the previous x days.

which option do i pick for keywords in the warm up section?

Randomized Warm-Up Limit – Instead of sending the exact same number of warm-up emails daily, this lets you introduce some randomness (in this case, ±20%) to make your sending patterns look more natural. Business Type – Choose your industry so warm-up emails and replies match what a real sender in your field would typically send. Helps improve domain reputation with ISPs. Warmup Schedule – Control when warm-up emails are sent instead of running them 24/7. Perfect if you want them to mimic real working hours. Warmup Custom Tracking Domain – Lets you use your own tracking domain for warm-up emails instead of generic ones, reducing the chance of ESPs flagging your links. Warmup Signature – Adds a signature to your warm-up emails, making them look more human-like and increasing credibility. Warmup Reply Rate – Adjust how often your warm-up emails get a reply. 35% here means for every 100 warm-up emails sent, 35 will get a reply to boost engagement and inbox trust. Basically, these settings let you fine-tune warm-up to m

Hello Yaro - a feature request in case you already have this functionality. When I add a contact to a campaign, automatically remove them from other campaigns if they exist.
Hi Sudeep, quite interesting feature. Will check with other users if they see use case.
Can you elaborate how you see usage here?

Sure. Campaign #1: first few steps are for them to watch a demo.  If they watch the demo, they ended up filling a form, and become an MQL, and then they should enter campaign #2 and be removed from Campaign #1.

While you guys work on this, is it possible for me to do the following via an API call? Find a lead in a workspace, if found, remove the lead from a campaign (or just stop any further sequences). And, then, add that same lead to another campaign.
yes you can delete lead via this endpoint: https://app.theneo.io/523c8ff1-6048-4b52-b6d6-6b0abcb8f751/pipl-ai-api-documentation/lead/delete-leads-from-a-campaign
for the above, we will consider adding it to the pipeline, but not something we can work on at the moment as we have other priorities.

Or You can also update the lead's status as COMPLETED so that no further sequence would be sent: https://app.theneo.io/523c8ff1-6048-4b52-b6d6-6b0abcb8f751/pipl-ai-api-documentation/lead/update-the-status-of-a-lead ​
i would prefer to NOT DELETE the lead and simply mark it as COMPLETE.  But, can that lead be added to another campaign after that, and start a sequence from the beginning?
yes. you can. for the add lead endpoint, make sure to pass skip_if_in_workspace = false
it means the lead will be added again, even if it existed in another campaign
so will the lead show up in both campaigns?
yes
ok thanks. this might work for us for the time being.
sure thanks
